p: The IR spectroscopy was employed in order to obtain important data on the chemical preservation and stoichiometric transfer of PLA/Fe 3O 4@EG material during the laser-assisted synthesis of thin films. For the dropcast sample, the IR spectrum (corresponding to the initial material) is depicted in Figure 7. Specific absorbance maxima in the composite sample are identified as corresponding to the following functional groups from both organic compounds: ~2995 cm −1 and ~2945 cm −1 (asymmetric and symmetric stretching of –CH 3), ~1753 cm −1 (strong stretching of C=O), ~1453 cm −1 (overlapped bending of C–H and C=O) and ~1089 cm −1 (stretching of C–O) [ 93, 94]. The IR peaks from ~1381 cm −1 and ~1185 cm −1 characterize bending of –CH 3 and asymmetric stretching of C–O–C from PLA [ 95, 96]. Stretching vibrations of C–O originating from the cyclic ether of eucalyptol may be assigned at ~1268 cm −1 [ 97, 98].
